intro: Pedicularis tachanensis, commonly known as the Tachan Valley lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its distinctive spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky and alpine environments, often in areas with poor soil conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
